title: Kenya: Crack Whip and Kenyans Will Get Value for Money
text:
The inordinate delays not only cost the country billions of shillings but also cause a lot of frustration among project users. 
These delays are also the biggest avenue for corruption and ineptitude. 
The President should ensure that his officials are clear about the scope, cost and benefits of the projects. 
They must also have stakeholder support, clear service descriptions and contractor and, or supplier due diligence must be done before project implementation begins. 
Appropriate contractual papers must be done, projects managed well and sufficient resources allocated to avoid a situation where the projects run out of cash. 
The President should not stop at complaining but reach a firm decision point and act, using the immense and legal powers bestowed on him to ensure that Kenyans get value for their money and within project implementation timelines. He must crack the whip. 
Quote of the day: "Sometimes it's worse to win a fight than to lose." - American jazz musician Billie Holiday died on July 17, 1959. Kenya
